intro: Neohallia borrerae, commonly known as the Mexican fireweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late summer and early fall. Neohallia borrerae typically grows in moist, sunny areas such as meadows and riverbanks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
